definition: fellow sufferers empathize with each other (idiom); misery loves company
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
illness/CL:場|场[chang2]/disease/to fall ill/defect
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to pity

sentences.english: Both Jane and Elizabeth felt uncomfortable, and sympathized with each other.
sentences.chinese: 簡和伊麗莎白都感到很不自在，兩人同病相憐。

sentences.english: Seek out others who were once in your current situation. Ask for their help.
sentences.chinese: 找出其他曾經和你同病相憐的人，向他們尋求幫助。

sentences.english: And what about Manchester United’s La Liga double Barcelona?
sentences.chinese: 而與曼聯同病相憐的，西甲的巴塞羅那境況又如何呢？

definition: unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to bear grudges
lit. the soul of a deceased has not yet dispersed (idiom)/fig. the influence still lingers on/the spirit (of some doctrine) is still alive
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
unwilling
(coll.) to go crazy/to lose it/demented/unhinged
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
